item.title: Azerbaijan and Armenia clash over disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region
item.description: Civilian deaths are reported as the two sides blame each other for hostilities over Nagorno-Karabakh.

item.title: Switzerland firmly rejects end of free movement with EU - projection
item.description: Projections suggest a referendum on annulling a pact with the European Union has failed.

item.title: Amy Coney Barrett: Trump nominates conservative favourite for Supreme Court
item.description: The nomination of a conservative judge paves the way for a bitter Senate fight as an election looms.

item.title: Amy Coney Barrett: Who is Trump's Supreme Court pick?
item.description: A favourite of social conservatives, Judge Barrett would swing the highest US court further right.

item.title: California wildfires: The inmates training to be firefighters
item.description: Brandon Smith is a former inmate firefighter and now helps former prisoners find jobs in the fire service.

item.title: Brain-eating microbe: US city warned over water supply
item.description: People in Lake Jackson, Texas, are urged to take precautionary measures amid contamination concerns.

item.title: Japanese actress Yuko Takeuchi found dead at 40
item.description: The award-winning actress and mother of two is believed to have taken her own life at the age of 40.

item.title: Brexit deal must be made, says UK business boss
item.description: The head of the Confederation of British Industry urges a "spirit of compromise" as trade talks resume.

item.title: Paris to commemorate female slave rebellion figure
item.description: A statue will honour Solitude, a black woman involved in a 1802 uprising in the French West Indies.

item.title: Britons 'bubbling out of pubs' since curfew
item.description: Shadow justice secretary David Lammy says drinkers are likely to continue their night together at home.

item.title: Sir David Attenborough: Naturalist gives Prince George a fossil at royal screening
item.description: Sir David presented Prince George with a fossilised shark tooth at a screening of his new programme.

item.title: The woman farmer who beat debt and stigma
item.description: Women should live life on their own terms, says Jyoti Deshmukh, who overcame the odds to become a successful farmer.

item.title: Prince Charles: A million young people need help
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic means it is a "particularly difficult time to be young", says Prince Charles.

item.title: Manny Pacquiao: Conor McGregor talks have begun, says assistant
item.description: Manny Pacquiao's special assistant says that the eight-weight world champion hopes to fight Conor McGregor in 2021.

item.title: French Open to start with fan numbers slashed
item.description: The opening day of the French Open sees three Britons - Andy Murray, Johanna Konta and Dan Evans - playing at Roland Garros.

item.title: Photography award winners show the fragility and beauty of mangrove forests
item.description: The Mangrove Photography Award winners show the beauty and fragility of the unique ecosystems.

item.title: Belarus protests: Opposition icon Nina Bahinskaya, 73, bundled into van
item.description: Nina Bahinskaya was again among dozens of women detained at a rally against Belarus's president.

item.title: Sparks fly during police chase in Los Angeles
item.description: Watch what happened when California Police tried to pull over a speeding pick-up truck.

item.title: Mumbai collapse: The man who filmed his ordeal under rubble
item.description: Khalid Khan was trapped for 10 hours after a building collapsed in the Indian city of Mumbai.

item.title: Courtroom escape sends police officer flying down stairs
item.description: A deputy went down the stairs head first trying to catch the defendant as he made a run for it.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sea swims help with lockdown mental health
item.description: More than 100 people are taking part in weekly sea swims at dawn after seeing a social media post.

item.title: Week in pictures: 19 - 25 September 2020
item.description: A selection of remarkable images taken around the world this week.

item.title: The fight for women's prayer rights in Israel
item.description: How a group of Jewish feminists demanded the same prayer rights as Jewish men.

item.title: Breonna Taylor: ‘Painful to be a black woman right now' says Yandy Smith-Harris
item.description: Activist and businesswoman Yandy Smith-Harris shares her reaction to the Breonna Taylor case decision.

item.title: 'Maskne': How to fight face mask breakouts
item.description: They're a part of everyday life, so how can you wear a face mask and have clear skin too?

item.title: Megan Thee Stallion: What do we know about the rapper's alleged shooting?
item.description: The rapper says she was shot in the feet by fellow artist Tory Lanez, who denies the accusation.

item.title: US election 2020: Fact-checking Trump on coronavirus
item.description: The president is under scrutiny for his response to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Italian family fosters Gambian migrant: 'The son we never had'
item.description: When Gambian orphan Muhammed Sanneh arrived in Sicily aged 16, his life took an unexpected turn.

item.title: Denmark confronts sexual harassment at work in #MeToo moment
item.description: It started with a comedy awards show and a bombshell revelation that left the audience stunned.

item.title: From a university bedroom to Broadway (almost)
item.description: The musical Six was pulled just hours before its New York debut because of Covid-19.

item.title: Barga: How Italy's most Scottish town coped without its annual 'invasion'
item.description: The population of Barga in Tuscany is usually swelled by visits from Scottish Italians every summer.

item.title: Singapore in world first for facial verification
item.description: The technology is being rolled out countrywide as part of Singapore's national identity scheme.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton penalty hands Russian Grand Prix win to Valtteri Bottas
item.description: Lewis Hamilton's quest for the all-time record of Formula 1 wins was put on hold when he was hit with penalties at the Russian Grand Prix.

item.title: The German medical students who want to learn about abortion
item.description: Lack of training is restricting access to abortion in Germany, but students are trying to change that.

item.title: Prince's Sign O' The Times: An oral history
item.description: Prince's collaborators recall the chaotic but fertile sessions that produced his greatest album.

item.title: Breonna Taylor: Why it's hard to charge US police over shootings
item.description: There are reasons why it's rare that excessive use of police force leads to a trial. Here they are.

item.title: Inside Poland’s 'LGBT-free zones'
item.description: Dozens of Polish towns have declared themselves free of "LGBT ideology". It means difficult choices for gay people living in them.

item.title: Rwandan genocide orphan's 'miracle' WhatsApp reunion
item.description: Grace Umutoni grew up not knowing her birth name, only that her parents had been killed in the Rwandan genocide.

item.title: ‘Our foster child asked us to adopt him – by drawing himself on to a family photo’
item.description: George was neglected by his parents, then an adoption went wrong. There was only one family that he felt loved by.
